title: Why are juggernauts a thing
body:
ok can someone please tell me how characters that get to just not die and one shot things are FUKING FAIR???
like adc and assassin and burst mage have high damage but are squishy, even yi and yas are squishy just fast so its hard to pin them down but the comes along Malphite who gets to build burst and still be tanky enough that they just get to be an assasin with a shield not that it matters because one ult will nuke a whole team and garen who gets to be the most brain dead champ in the game, redic damge between his spin and ult and A SILENCE, plus tank stats and healing and hes fast af with his q, and Mundo with his healing an percentage damage meaning he can build tank and still do damage even grievous wounds doesn't stop these guys

I get it there has to be some low skill champs for new comers but when they just get to get fed and be unstoppable.
The current meta is just bad with no good balancing when one person feeds its gg... and that makes the team game aspect pointless

ive  had so many games where i do ok in my lane just for ONE fed player on the other team to start getting penta kills like its going out of style

1. Malphite is a tank not a juggernaut. He can also be played as a full body burst mage projectile, but that's been nerfed a fair amount so it is hardly a problem
2. Garen is a juggernaut, and so is sett. They have numbers that seem to you like they are overtuned because they have 0 mobility, almost 0 range, and as such are highly unreliable at applying damage. These sorts of champs need survivability to ever do anything at all in a game where other champs can just poke them from range and dash away from them with ease.
So yes, juggernauts do mostly do absurd damage for how tanky they are. However, it is all the fault of the person who gets hit. If you messed up and got caught as an adc or mage by something like darius away from your team and then on top of that you fail to kite him properly which you certainly can (unlike zed) unless he has a yuumi, then you deserve to die as surely as if you got caught by a zed or rengar.
Tldr: yes, sett is op, that's why he is getting nerfed, no jusggernauts are not op you just need better kiting mechanics

Unless you're also a juggernaut, then no you aren't as strong as a juggernaut in melee range. How TF is a normal non-CertainlyT bruiser supposed to compete with Darius's 8050 gold worth passive? He legit walks to lane with a 1050 gold worth passive AT LEVEL ONE. It's not even like his passive takes anything from his abilities either. He has 3 normal functioning abilities + his ult.

Generally what you do into Darius is disengage before he hits the 5 bleeds and focus on taking short trades.

For example Garen takes Phase rush, buys a Bami cinder, then just basically runs up hits him and runs away over and over again to beat out a Darius.

>The only bruiser that could beat juggernauts, being Aatrox has been nerfed into oblivion. While the rest of the top picks are Ornn + other juggernauts.

Fun fact: Aatrox is classed as a juggernaut.

Eh, he really isn't one. Aatrox has a 950 engage range with just E + Q1 and 1100 with E + W, and also has a 60-100% refreshing movement speed buff when ulting. While Garen has a 3.5 second 30% movement speed buff. Darius has a 525 range pull. Morde has a 700 range pull that is easy to dodge, 650 range on ult and 3% movement speed buff on passive. Sett has a 490 range pull with a 1.5 second 30% movement speed buff, his ult has 400 range. Illaoi has a 350 range targeted dash. Urgot has a 475 range dash with a huge CD. 

The above champions only need 1-2 damage items and then after that go tank, because their in kit damage is so high. While Aatrox still has to continue buying damage items for the entire game or simply fall into irrelevancy. He is much more similar to a Riven or Fiora. With his low cooldowns and sustain = damage. Compared to Juggernauts which typically have high in kit damage, while relying on purely items for sustain.
New Aatrox is a Juggernaut, old Aatrox was a Diver. New Aatrox only has a very short ranged dash + chains to keep people close both of which are easy to dodge.
Yeah bro only a low cd dash, two long range cc's and a massive movement speed buff, real immobile brah.

They probably have him slotted as a Juggernaut because he has to stop moving a lot for his Q and his attacks are all really telegraphed. The examples you gave (Riven and Fiora) are much more mobile in combat and deal a lot more consistent damage. Aatrox's a weirdo but with how slow they designed his damage to be I don't think he can be classified as anything besides Juggernaut.

(Yes I know it's not that that slow in the grand scheme of things but he still needs to take 2-5ish seconds to kill people while standing still for most of it even if he's super fed. Unlike a Riven who can oneshot a squishy target or Fiora who can stay mobile while slapping you due it being autos and not abilities with a cast time. So even if he builds all damage he's not gonna start obliterating you within eyeblinks.)

mordekaiser always was one but they gave him too much with his new rework...why 2 forms of reliable crowd control...the point of juggernauts is that you have to be good at predicting and working around opponents while being generally less reliable in team fights

yet he has 2 displacements and one is targeted...

Massive power and predictable patterns... If these are your determining factors for a juggernaut then Ryze is a juggernaut. He has massive power and predictable patterns. High base and scaling health, high base MR, gets +1k effective health from his two core items. He is predictable in that if you ever get in range he will EQ and / or EW you. He requires prediction to hit his Q's. Bad definition of juggernaut.

Because literally everyone else in the game can destroy a game given enough ressources and, to be honest, there is still counterplay to a fed Juggernaut, while a fed Assassin is basically impossible to control unless the opposing team has a direct counter.

They are not fair. Objectively they are not. You could argue they are balanced, but balanced =/= fair. Juggernauts as a champion class completely ruin top lane. They force top lane into a counter pick meta with Juggernaut beats Bruiser, Bruiser beats Ranged, Ranged beats Juggernaut. You can't first pick bruisers because then they pick a juggernaut and just destroy you, can't first pick a juggernaut because then you get counter picked by ranged, you can't first pick ranged because then they pick a mobile bruiser. In an ideal scenario top lane should be a bruiser vs bruiser skill matchup, with all top lane champions having the in kit tools to beat ranged. But juggernauts win every melee matchup and lose ranged matchups, completely fucking the lane.

Look at the best and most played top laners right now. 

https://imgur.com/a/W48VXgK

The only bruiser that could beat juggernauts, being Aatrox has been nerfed into oblivion. While the rest of the top picks are Ornn + other juggernauts.

Juggernauts as a class just need to be completely removed from the game or forced out of top lane into the jungle. The class only exists to let bad players beat better players due to champion pick.

Yes I understand that juggernauts do have weaknesses, being that they can be easily kited, and don't teamfight well. And thats exactly why they ruin top lane.  They make you useless while they themselves are also useless.

They normally have to meet a condition before they can do what they do. Morde has to get his passive, darius has to stack his passive, mundo needs his ult, illaoi needs tentacles, yorick needs maiden, Sett needs to take damage to hit his W center hit. Garen is an exception, but he can't really 1v5 because he doesn't have the damage to kill a lot of people, just burst one person down with ult.

Their defense has conditions too; morde needs to do damage to have a big w, darius needs to hit q sweetspot, mundo chunks himself in lane if he doesn't hit cleavers, illaoi needs tentacles to sustain, yorick doesn't really have good sustain until he can get in to spam q at 1/2 hp with conq, sett needs to take damage to get his shield. Garen, once again, is the exception, but it's really more of a once per fight type of ability and isn't as effective for its whole duration.

Darius just needs to get into pull range, i.e. flash or ghost.  Once he starts hitting you he's way, way faster than you and there's just no escape.  You definitely aren't going to kill him before he finishes stacking unless you're way ahead of him already.

Sett is much the same way, his W still chunks a squishy even without his rage.  Against Sett you can avoid most of his damage easily if you have mobility.  If you don't have mobility, you're free food for him.

And then there's actual tanks that just do stupid amounts of damage, like Nautilus support early game, or Ornn at any time.  It's really not fun to be facing an Ornn who's building full tank so you barely tickle him, but if you misplay even the slightest and he lands anything on you, you instantly lose half your HP (and are CC'd into next week so you're probably fully dead).

It's like Roadhog was in early Overwatch.  Tons and tons and tons of HP so he took a whole lot of shots to kill, and if you misplayed at all, he would one-shot you with his hook ability.  It was extremely frustrating to play against.
I mean if they have to use summoner spells to kill you( a ranged champ) and thats the only way they can, they must be pretty weak once the spells are on cooldown right?

Once Darius has phage or one of its upgrades he generally doesn't even NEED it, as he can kill a minion, get a burst of move speed and use that to get the pull.  But if you're dying only every time ghost comes off cooldown, that's still a very very fed Darius coming at you midgame.

People complain about ranged tops, but in order to fight Darius you actually have to also have mobility or extra kiting ability.  A regular mage will just get pulled when you try to go for cs and then murdered.
I actually don't mind juggernauts, at least you can kite them out and they don't dash 1000 units across the screen and kill you in .5 seconds.

>ok can someone please tell me how characters that get to just not die and one shot things are FUKING FAIR???

False premise the entire argument falls apart.

Juggernauts are litterally tanks who trade utility and (in most cases) range and/or some mobility for damage.

The whole concept of juggernauts is combining high damage and high resistances while not having anything else. They are the most easily juked class in the whole and, to be honest, they barely pose any threat unless they are overstated since the game is oversaturated in mobility, range and tank melting damage, three options who directly counter juggernauts. You are basically complaining about a champion class who's whole counterplay is simply to not stand still in front of them hoping to burst them.

I find it disgusting how much people here forgot what to do when they can't simply one-combo one-shot anything so they complain about anything that can take it and actually hit back. "Oh no, I stood still in front of Darius watching me auto me while I used a single ability because I thought I could oneshot him, and now he killed me! Where's the counterplay?!?!?". Funniest part is people complaining about Sett's shield because of its size, still not understanding several weeks after release that the shield simply fades away in mere seconds (hell, the THIRD of his shield is already faded out after he simply CASTS any other ability). Oh and this ability deals so much true damage oh my god, if only you could side-step it hmmm...

First Malphite and Mundo aren't juggernauts, they are tanks. Every champ can carry when ahead. Second solo q was always about who wins lane and who can carry with his lead or who outscales. If u go even it was never good in solo q.
